issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.customfield_12310192: Modified CapacityScheduler to use only users with pending requests for computing user-limits.

fields.summary: Make gridmix performance on YARN+MR to match or exceed that on 1.0

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: CS should only use 'activeUsers with pending requests' for computing user-limits, similar to what is done in hadoop-1.
fields.summary: CS should only use 'activeUsers with pending requests' for computing user-limits

comments.body: The patch seems to work, need to do some more testing and add some unit tests.

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12511968/MAPREDUCE-3732.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    -1 core tests.  The patch failed these unit tests:
                  org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.resourcemanager.scheduler.capacity.TestApplicationLimits

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1683//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1683//console

This message is automatically generated.
@Arun, looks like this is failing the tests.

+1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12512094/MAPREDUCE-3732.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    +1 core tests.  The patch passed unit tests in .

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1701//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1701//console

This message is automatically generated.
Looking at the patch for review/commit.

    MAPREDUCE-3732. Modified CapacityScheduler to use only users with pending requests for computing user-limits. Contributed by Arun C Murthy.
